GTG. I'll post with the rest of my chars from school.

::Prowl::

Prowl falls backwards as he is released, landing on his butt. He 
gritts his teeth in pain as his damaged arm hits the floor, the 
Maximal quickly jumping to his feet.

He was leaking fluids freely from wounds in his chest, and his arm 
was sending constant screams of pain through him.

"Iron Raptor, are you allright?"

It might have been ironic to ask that question at that point, with 
him bleeding all over the floor and Iron Raptor standing in front of 
him mostly unharmed, but he was worried about her mental condition 
more than his physical.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * The sound of his pain was welcomed, but only to the more evil and 
cunning 
> side of her systems which controlled her beast modes. The other 
side was 
> completely applaud that she could have ever had such modes in the 
first 
> place, even considering aborting them once or if she ever managed 
to gain 
> control of her functions again.
> But even the thought of abortion brought on a more will for the 
modes to 
> live and act, which only urged them on to swamp out her systems 
more and 
> more each moment. However, they would never be able to get total 
control.
> 
> The creature was urged on to continue its acts as it hears Prowls 
arm snap, 
> the painful expression on his face rather satisfying. The mech-
fluid only 
> clarifying  it's sinful deeds.
> However, while the modes were distracted by their pleasure of 
Prowls pain, 
> the more logical and robotic side of her systems were slowly and 
surely 
> inching for control.
> It saw Prowl through the eyes of this mode, through the keen sight, 
which 
> was sure enough to miss nothing. And what it saw made its spark 
almost 
> shatter in fear.
> Iron Raptors beast modes were tarring up the only bot she had ever 
loved, 
> and with no reason at all.
> However, little did she know that it was only the blood lust, which 
she had 
> been keeping contained. which was being shown.
> Not enough time in the battlefield to ease the strain of two deadly 
and 
> horrific beast modes. And now, released and unable to be contained, 
they 
> were expelling their rages that would have been used in war.
> 
> She flexed her claws, only managing to sink them deeper into Prowls 
armor. 
> Her weight baring down against him, wanting to push him to the 
floor and 
> have him off his feet. A vulnerable position for any stalked prey.
> But then she heard it, something that brought a rather surprising 
reaction 
> from her.
> Love? Did she know that word, did she know that name? Yes, yes she 
did. But 
> where, how?
> The beast modes were confused, but the logic knew better.
> In one fleeting moment, as she looked into Prowls face, she knew 
just who he 
> was and why he was here. She remembered.
> And in that same moment, the logic took more control over the 
massive form.
> With a heave of her body she moved from Prowl, still in a little 
confusion 
> but not as much as before.
> But he was right, just WHAT was she doing? Attacking the only thing 
in this 
> entire stinking world that she loved even more then her own self.
> 
> She stepped back and looked at him, mech-fluid ridden and in pain.
> SHE was the one who had caused this, had caused the pain which 
twisted his 
> features at that very moment.
> And at that moment, she was disgusted with herself.
> 
> Her beast modes fought back to regain control, wanting to at least 
taste his 
> fluid against its tongue once again. But there was no way past the 
logic 
> now, the logic which could not completely master control but enough 
to know 
> what it was doing was wrong. Way wrong.
> 
> So, she simply stood there now, her mouth dripping mech-fluid and 
acidic 
> saliva, simply staring at Prowl with an expression which 
communicated her 
> problem. Her body stiff and alert, but questioning of its own 
reactions 
> now.*
